import can

# Set up the CAN bus (change channel and bustype as per your setup)
bus = can.interface.Bus(channel='can0', bustype='socketcan')  # For Raspberry Pi

# Define your CAN ID and raw data bytes
can_id = 0x7DF  # Or whatever functional/physical ID you're using
data = [0x02, 0x27, 0x01] + [0x00]*5  # 8 bytes total (padding to fill frame)

# Create and send the CAN frame
msg = can.Message(arbitration_id=can_id, data=data, is_extended_id=False)

try:
    bus.send(msg)
    print("Message sent:", msg)
except can.CanError as e:
    print("Message not sent:", e)
